Dear Waugh Community,

Waugh will make a formal announcement regarding plans for school closure after we proceed with a consultation with the Department of Health Services and other Sonoma County school districts early next week. At this point a closure beyond Spring Break appears imminent so families should be finalizing their childcare plans.

Please also be aware that all Waugh Kids Care programs, including the Wallabies preschool program and our Spring Break childcare program, are closed starting on March 16 (Monday). Families with students enrolled in these programs were notified of the closure earlier today.

I will provide you with an update by Monday at 5:00pm. In the meantime, please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or concerns.

SIncerely,

Mike Gardner

Dear Waugh Community,

We have a fantastic opportunity to express our appreciation to individuals impacted by the Kincade Fire. This Saturday (11/23), 3:00-8:30 a group of local businesses will be hosting a free dinner for fire survivors, first responders, and relief volunteers at the Santa Rosa Hyatt Regency.

We are proud that two of our Waughsome parents, Dominic Magnani and Jamie Lloyd, are deeply involved in the planning of this great event. The organizers are in need of drivers to deliver meals to every firehouse in Sonoma County on Saturday. We would love for Waugh parents to step into this important volunteer role, and to consider bringing along our students for the ride so they can also experience this important community event.

More information about the Giving Thanks Dinner is attached to this message. Please contact Dominic Magnani bayarea49er@gmail.com if you have any questions.

To signup for a volunteer shift, please go to: https://signup.com/go/kvytdne

Sincerely,

Mike Gardner
Superintendent
